Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the accusation against Keith Ellison by stating that he "beats his girlfriend," without providing sufficient evidence to support this claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or proof of the alleged abuse.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Democrats made Keith Ellison the deputy chair of the DNC despite the allegations, when in fact he had held the position since 2017 before the allegations came to light.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Keith Ellison was accused of abuse by his ex-girlfriend in 2018, but no evidence has been released to prove the allegations.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the possibility of alternative explanations or perspectives regarding the allegations against Keith Ellison.
